sections.name: Our story
text: The concept for The School of Contemplative Life first arose three years ago, following much enthusiasm and support from spiritual leaders and members of the community.  A physical home will be sought to house the School in due course.
Until that time, our energy is focused on delivering a programme of teaching and practice to help people become places of peace in the world and live in greater harmony with each other.

sections.name: Our founder
sections.title: Christopher Whittington
text: Christopher Whittington was introduced to meditation and contemplative life at the age of 19 during a period of formation at the Benedictine monastery of Prinknash Abbey, after which he studied at the Dalai Lamaâ€™s monastery in India.  Chris regularly delivers talks, workshops and retreats across the UK.

Chris is also the Head of Education Law at a unique social purpose law firm where he has introduced contemplative practice to hundreds of leaders and staff working in the social and commercial sectors, helping them to lead and work more collaboratively and compassionately, build community within their organisations and enhance wellbeing.
